abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Urban Infrastructure and
            Services Delivery Project for Bosnia and Herzegovina were as
            follows: outcomes were satisfactory; risk to development
            outcome was moderate; Bank performance was moderately
            satisfactory and borrower performance was also satisfactory.
            Some lessons learned includes: in fragile contexts,
            ring-fence project management teams from political
            interference and place project implementation with direct
            beneficiaries. In post-conflict contexts, stay focused on a
            few essential activities even if opportunities abound.
            Expand capacity through mentoring opportunities between
            beneficiaries. Future involvement in the water sector should
            bring focus on efficiency and sustainability. Project
            outcome assessments should be continuous. Stable task
            management combining technical expertise and local knowledge
            improves project implementation.
